instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.SMC_LID_R: What is SMC_LID_R? SMC_LID_R is the signal coming from the hall sensor that detects whether the laptop screen is closed or open. This must be high in order for SMC_LID to be high. SMC_LID has to be high for the machine to not fall asleep and for it to have a backlight..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message:
liquid damage, cleaned and everything looks relatively good except no backlight (image on screen) and probably thunderbolt caps may be shot

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> only 12.6V too low

<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> 3.2V ok

<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> 0V bad

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_R</SIGNAL> 3.4 ok




replaced <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>

now <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> 3V
but still no backlight

what next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message: Corroded feedback trace(S). Usually to pin A5 and/or B1/B2. Read sticky on backlight repair too.
